chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L Edgerton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.  Defendant to pay restitution on a regular monthly basis through probation.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by an other means with the victims, or co-defendant Casey Thundercloud.  Exception for attendance and testimony at trial.  

If any of the victims request contact, it must be in writing to the agent.  Agent to determine contact.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant must cooperate with the prosecution of his co-defendant Casey Thundercloud.  If Mr. Thundercloud's case goes to trial, defendant must give full, complete and truthful testimony at the trial.  Defendant may not invoke his 5th Amendment Rights.

Amount of restitution to be determined. To be paid joint and several with co-defendant Casey Thundercloud.  AS A RESULT OF RESTITUTION HEARING HELD ON 3/3/16.  Total restitution ordered:  $32,103.67.   Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: same as prison sentence.

1.  Letter to DA from the defendant.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Hanson.  Letter from defendant to DA filed with the court.  Discussion held regarding the letter.  Defense took a break to speak with the defendant.  Attorney Betthauser also has appeared.  Attorney Hanson says that the letter the defendant sent, the defendant longer wants the court to consider it.  Defendant is retracting his letter of 2/14/16.   Court questioned defendant.  He confirmed. Attorney Betthauser discussed a possible conflict, which has resolved.  Defendant is not contesting the restitution request.  Total restitution ordered: $ 32,998.31,  Joint & Several w/Casey Thundercloud in 15CF124.

Victim information from victim/witness coordinator.
Associated with Charge #2

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Hanson.  Victim notification complied with.  Restitution is agreed to as $32,998.31.  Defendant hasn't read the restitution worksheet.  He's been busy.  Court asks why he didn't read the restitution worksheet. He's been busy.   Restitution issue adjourned.  Proceed with sentencing.  Joint recommendation.  14 mo ic.  2 yrs. ES.  Condition:  If co-defendant C.T. has jury trial,  he must give complete and truthful testimony at that trial.  Defendant to not invoke his 5th Amendment Right.  Restitution, joint and several w/ co-defendant in 15CF124.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defense requests that sentencing be deferred until after the co-defendant's trial.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. Victim, M.B. addressed the court.  

Court ordered:  total 5 years.  18 mo ic, 3 1/2 years ES. Consecutive to sentence now serving.   Pay restitution, joint and several with co-defendant, TBD. Cooperate with the prosecution of C.T.   Give full, truthful and complete testimony at that trial.  Defendant to not invoke his 5th Amendment Right.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample   Seek and obtain full time employment.  Pay restitution on a regular monthly basis through probation.  No contact with victims or the co-defendant, except for trial testimoney.   Victims to advise DOC if they want contact in writing.  Agent to determine.  Defendant to advise Attorney Hanson by 2/12 if he is requesting restitution hearing.  Attorney Hanson to advise court by 2/17 if a restitution hearing is needed.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Hanson.  Victim notification complied with.  Attorney Hanson requests a restitution hearing.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2 as charged.  Counts 1 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood. Court confirmed prior conviction.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 2.  Victim C.D. present.  She made a statement to the court.  Victim M.B. present.  She made a statement to the court.  No other victims present.  Sentencing to be set before February 12, 2016.  Victims to be notified by telephone and mail of the sentencing date.  1/2 hour.
Information filed in court.  Reading of the information waived.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Hanson.  Court reviewed the form with the defendant and questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
